ABOUT.TITLE: About Me
ABOUT.SUBTITLE: Junior Developer in apprenticeship
ABOUT.DESCRIPTION: Currently in 2nd year of engineering school at ISIMA in Clermont-Ferrand, I am on a work-study program at CGI for the client Michelin.
ABOUT.MORE: As a network and development enthusiast, I am curious to discover new ways of programming as well as new technologies. I have carried out several projects in Flutter, and numerous APIs in PHP Slim as well as in Java SpringBoot. I am developing a microservice in Spring Boot and a full stack Angular/NodeJs application as part of my work-study program, which allows me to develop my skills in Java, NodeJs and Angular.

PIANO.DESC: My grandmother taught me piano when I was in primary school, and I resumed as a self-taught musician 5 years ago

COURSE.DESC: I started training in early 2024, and I completed the 'Course des Volcans' (25km, 550d+) and the 'Course des 9 Clochers' (28km, 550d+) at the end of 2024

CINEMA.TITLE: Cinema
CINEMA.DESC: A cinephile thanks to my sister and parents, I continue going to the cinema regularly and enjoy sharing my favorite movies and series with my friends and family

DAFL.TITLE: DAFL Music
DAFL.DESCRIPTION:
DAFL Music is a project I did with 3 classmates as part of our 2nd year IT program.

The project concept is inspired by Tinder and Spotify. For example, you install the DAFL Music mobile app and meet someone else with the app. The app then shows the music that person was listening to on your phone, allowing you to discover new music and artists.

Once you liked the other person’s track, if they liked yours too at the same meeting moment, you can chat together and share music discoveries.

This project was a real technical challenge, as we used a technology we didn’t know, Flutter, and had to implement several servers such as the messaging server. We did a good job but didn’t have time to finish it completely.

Below are some images of our project, and the repository link:

FANTOM.TITLE: Fantom Games
FANTOM.DESCRIPTION:
Fantom Games was realized as part of my 3rd year IT program. In a team of 4, we built a website with mini-games allowing users to earn crypto-assets while having fun.

Want to play mini-games with your friends and earn money at the same time? Fantom Games is the site for that! The project context was simple, each mini-game victory gives Fantom Coin, a crypto-asset developed specifically for the project.

The site features tic-tac-toe and battleship. Here’s the server link (still in development, may have bugs): https://www.fantomgames.eu

This project was very complex technically. Deploying a crypto-asset was expensive, but we still managed most of the tasks. The site works despite budget limits.

Below are some images of our project, and the repository link:
FANTOM.TECHNOLOGIES: Flutter, Dart, Socket IO (Javascript), PHP Slim, Docker, Reverse Proxy, Cryptocurrency

TEMOIGNAGES.TITLE: Testimonials
TEMOIGNAGES.DESCRIPTION:
Last 2nd year project, Testimonials aims to collect student and teacher feedback and display them online.

The topic was provided by our department and highlights real experiences of people who attended the program, to guide potential students.

For example, we interviewed several students and teachers, filming short 5-minute videos to ask questions and gather insights.

The project was simple on paper, but we faced difficulties like website deployment and workload issues within the team, preventing a perfect and fully functional site.

Below are some images of our project, and the repository link:
TEMOIGNAGES.TECHNOLOGIES: HTML, CSS, PHP, PHP Slim, SQL

IFTLZ.TITLE: IFTLZ
IFTLZ.DESCRIPTION:
IFTLZ is a project that aims to recognize sounds using signal processing (Fourier transform) during the first year of engineering school at ISIMA. The subject was given by our professors at the beginning of the year and allowed us to integrate solid mathematical concepts into a computer science project.

The project was divided into two parts: the first one for designing the project, and the second one for developing the solution. Our project went well, the work distribution was efficient, and we managed to deliver a functional application that used the Spotify API to retrieve information about the music our application analyzed. This project allowed us to successfully validate the year and also gain many skills in modeling and project organization.
IFTLZ.TECHNOLOGIES: Flutter, Dart, PHP Slim, Reverse Proxy, Python, Spotify API

EXP1.COMPANY: Customer advisor at Sarl Top Modèle, Lozanne, 69380
EXP1.DESCRIPTION: My first summer job, I was able to discover the business world and improve my communication and sales skills while working in a small team.

EXP2.DESCRIPTION: My first internship during my BUT program, where I gained experience in database scripting, monitoring, and teamwork in an industrial context.

TASKS.1: Developed a flow management and monitoring application
TASKS.2: Wrote numerous SQL scripts with Oracle

EXP3.DESCRIPTION: After my internship, CGI offered me an apprenticeship. This allowed me to work on real client projects, strengthen my technical skills, and be fully integrated in the MB4 team of the CORTEX program.

TASKS.4: Configured Kafka and AKHQ with Docker

EXP4.DESCRIPTION: After my first apprenticeship year at CGI, I continued in the same position to accompany my first year at ISIMA engineering school.

TASKS.2: Developed a service to optimize Industrialization and Production deployments
TASKS.3: Created a service using Angular and NodeJS
